attributes.action: demand that the Republic of Ireland changes the tricolour as its flag as it is offensive to Unionists because it lays claim to Northern Ireland
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The orange on the Irish tricolour represents the territorial claim of successive Irish governments to Northern Ireland. They have got rid of Articles 2 and 3 from their constitution which stated that the government of the Republic lay claim to the entire island.

The orange on the flag does exactly the same. Northern Ireland is British, until a majority of its citizens say so.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
